meanings.definition: A person with whom one shares a secret or private matter.
meanings.sent1: My sister is one of my confidants, and I tell her everything.
meanings.sent2: She has a few confidants at work whom she trusts with important information.
meanings.sent3: At the secret confidants' meeting, we all shared our favorite ice cream flavors.
meanings.sent4: The confidants in the spy movie exchanged coded messages under the moonlight.
meanings.sent5: In the fairy tale, the princess's confidants were the talking animals in the forest.

meanings.definition: A close friend or associate whom one trusts and confides in.
meanings.sent1: He considers his childhood friend to be one of his most loyal confidants.
meanings.sent2: She and her confidants often meet for coffee to catch up on each other's lives.
meanings.sent3: The confidants in the comedy show always end up in hilarious situations together.
meanings.sent4: Their friendship was like a ship sailing smoothly with confidants as the crew.
meanings.sent5: The confidants in the story were like puzzle pieces fitting perfectly together.
